meanings.definition: (verb) to enter a state of suspended animation
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar diapaused during the winter months, waiting to emerge as a butterfly in the spring.
meanings.sent2: The seeds diapaused in the ground until the conditions were right for germination.
meanings.sent3: The bear diapaused in its den, dreaming of the sunny days ahead.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to diapause as she held her breath, waiting for the results.
meanings.sent5: The city diapaused in anticipation of the upcoming festival, frozen in excitement.

meanings.definition: (adjective) in a state of suspended animation
meanings.sent1: The diapaused insects remained motionless, conserving their energy for the next season.
meanings.sent2: The diapaused plants appeared lifeless during the harsh winter, ready to bloom again in spring.
meanings.sent3: The diapaused computer screen seemed frozen in time, waiting for a command to resume.
meanings.sent4: The diapaused lake reflected the stillness of the surrounding mountains, creating a serene landscape.
meanings.sent5: The diapaused spacecraft drifted silently through the vast emptiness of space, a dormant traveler.
